TITLE: Using Metadata in Elixir Documentation
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to use metadata in documentation attributes in Elixir. It encompasses using keys like `:deprecated`, `:group`, and `:since` to enrich documentation for users.
SOURCE: https://github.com/elixir-lang/elixir/blob/main/lib/elixir/pages/getting-started/writing-documentation.md#2025-04-21_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: elixir
CODE:
```
```elixir
@doc deprecated: "Use Foo.bar/2 instead"
@deprecated "Use Foo.bar/2 instead"
@doc group: "Query"
def all(query)

@doc group: "Schema"
def insert(schema)

@doc since: "1.3.0"
def world(name) do
  IO.puts("hello #{name}")
end
```

TITLE: Defining Language-Sensitive Case Mappings for Lithuanian in Unicode
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines language-sensitive case mappings for Lithuanian, handling the retention of dots in lowercase i when followed by accents and introducing explicit dots when lowercasing capital I's and J's with additional accents.
SOURCE: https://github.com/elixir-lang/elixir/blob/main/lib/elixir/unicode/SpecialCasing.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: Unicode
CODE:
```
0307; 0307; ; ; lt After_Soft_Dotted; # COMBINING DOT ABOVE

0049; 0069 0307; 0049; 0049; lt More_Above; # LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I
004A; 006A 0307; 004A; 004A; lt More_Above; # LATIN CAPITAL LETTER J
012E; 012F 0307; 012E; 012E; lt More_Above; # LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH OGONEK
00CC; 0069 0307 0300; 00CC; 00CC; lt; # LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH GRAVE
00CD; 0069 0307 0301; 00CD; 00CD; lt; # LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH ACUTE
0128; 0069 0307 0303; 0128; 0128; lt; # LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH TILDE
```

CODE:
```
defmodule MyRequestHandler do
  def parse(%{"status" => status, "message" => message} = _payload) do
    %{status: String.to_atom(status), message: message}
  end
end

TITLE: Defining a Struct with Many Fields in Elixir
DESCRIPTION: An example of defining a struct with 35 fields, which can lead to performance issues due to changes in internal representation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/elixir-lang/elixir/blob/main/lib/elixir/pages/anti-patterns/code-anti-patterns.md#2025-04-21_snippet_19

LANGUAGE: elixir
CODE:
```
defmodule MyExample do
  defstruct [
    :field1,
    :field2,
    ...,
    :field35
  ]
end
```

TITLE: Unquoting a list with unquote_splicing in Elixir
DESCRIPTION: This snippet showcases the use of `unquote_splicing/1` to inject the elements of a list into another list within a quoted expression.  Unlike `unquote/1`, `unquote_splicing/1` inserts the list's elements directly into the target list. The elements of `inner` are spliced into the list `[1, 2, unquote_splicing(inner), 6]`.
SOURCE: https://github.com/elixir-lang/elixir/blob/main/lib/elixir/pages/meta-programming/quote-and-unquote.md#2025-04-21_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: elixir
CODE:
```
iex> inner = [3, 4, 5]
iex> Macro.to_string(quote do: [1, 2, unquote_splicing(inner), 6])
"[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]"
```

TITLE: Configuring Test Filters and Tags
DESCRIPTION: This Elixir snippet demonstrates how to configure test filtering in ExUnit by using tags like :distributed to manage test execution based on network connectivity and node availability.
SOURCE: https://github.com/elixir-lang/elixir/blob/main/lib/elixir/pages/mix-and-otp/distributed-tasks.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: elixir
CODE:
```
exclude =
  if Node.alive?(), do: [], else: [distributed: true]

ExUnit.start(exclude: exclude)
```

TITLE: Defining Language-Sensitive Case Mappings for Turkish and Azeri in Unicode
DESCRIPTION: This snippet defines language-sensitive case mappings for Turkish and Azeri, handling special cases for I, i, and i-dotless characters, including removal of dot above in certain sequences and specific uppercasing and lowercasing rules.
SOURCE: https://github.com/elixir-lang/elixir/blob/main/lib/elixir/unicode/SpecialCasing.txt#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: Unicode
CODE:
```
0130; 0069; 0130; 0130; tr; # LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH DOT ABOVE
0130; 0069; 0130; 0130; az; # LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH DOT ABOVE

0307; ; 0307; 0307; tr After_I; # COMBINING DOT ABOVE
0307; ; 0307; 0307; az After_I; # COMBINING DOT ABOVE

0049; 0131; 0049; 0049; tr Not_Before_Dot; # LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I
0049; 0131; 0049; 0049; az Not_Before_Dot; # LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I

0069; 0069; 0130; 0130; tr; # LATIN SMALL LETTER I
0069; 0069; 0130; 0130; az; # LATIN SMALL LETTER I
```

TITLE: Scripting Mode Math Module
DESCRIPTION: Math module implementation with immediate output for scripting purposes.

    a + b
  end
end

```

TITLE: Function Head with Default Arguments
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates the use of function heads when combining default arguments with multiple clauses.
SOURCE: https://github.com/elixir-lang/elixir/blob/main/lib/elixir/pages/getting-started/modules-and-functions.md#2025-04-21_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: elixir
CODE:
```
defmodule Concat do
  # A function head declaring defaults
  def join(a, b, sep \\ " ")

  def join(a, b, _sep) when b == "" do
    a
  end

  def join(a, b, sep) do
    a <> sep <> b
  end
end

IO.puts(Concat.join("Hello", ""))           #=> Hello
IO.puts(Concat.join("Hello", "world"))      #=> Hello world
IO.puts(Concat.join("Hello", "world", "_")) #=> Hello_world
```
